title: I would like to become an active Quora writer, what steps do you recommend? - Quora

response.answer_text: All you have to do is start writing on Quora and you’ll be ‘an active Quora writer.’ It really is as simple as that! Look for questions on topics that interest you and that you know something about. If there are already answers to the question, it helps if you can contribute a different perspective or an interesting (and relevant) anecdote. People don’t want to read the same answer expressed in ten very similar ways. If you are writing on an issue of fact rather than opinion, don’t contribute to misinformation. Make sure you have your facts right. There are many (often very popular) answers on Quora which are factually incorrect. Adding footnotes and links from reliable sources is a good way to show that you have done your research, and is helpful for any readers who want to investigate further. If writing is not your strong suit, accept edit suggestions if they are given—people are only trying to make your answer better. They’re doing you a favour, not insulting you. Use spellcheck, and make sure you correctly capitalise and punctuate. Those little things may not seem like a big deal, but they all help your answers to be more readable, and therefore more acceptable to the Quora audience. Don’t worry about views or upvotes—write because you enjoy it, and because you think that you have something to say. Good luck!

Thanks for the A2A To become a Quora writer you first have to make a start. Read up your lines of interest and scrutinise other popular Quora writers. Understand how they build audience. This is hard work and although it is sucking up your valuable time it still gives you exposure to a vast bank of readers. For a novelist Quora is a priceless tool to keep updated on rolling news. I hit on Quora, accidentally, two years ago and have now chalked up 7.63 million viewers and answered 2600 odd questions. So far it has been fun. Only one reader was reported for insulting me. But hey! 7.63 million viewers enjoyed my work . That’s enough publicity. I’m not aiming for any super stardom or anything fancy. All I want to do is wear some Quora bling and puff my chest out and feel my ego pushing my head a fraction. That’s good enough. More than the ego boost Quora is a great tool for word gyms. I love that part of it. Although I make a huge number of mistakes in my answers most readers are forgiving. So begin your journey today. Read, Understand, write. If you can be funny then please be funny. YO can say the rudest thing in a funnier way. Always be nice to everybody. Take no sides and never get into any kind of online fight. Be flexible in your answers and wise in your questions. Be sincere. YOu can make a lot of friends and fiends. Good luck.
